revised_title: Interference Phenomena in Electric Waves: Investigating the Effect of Electrolyte Thickness
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the interference phenomena in electric waves passing through different thicknesses of electrolyte. They discovered that the intensity of the transmitted ray does not steadily decrease, and the transmission follows the same general law as for light with a thin plate. The findings provide insights into the behavior of electromagnetic waves in different media and contribute to the understanding of wave interference and electrolyte properties.
